Description: Fragment of a green glazed composition tile or fitting, with representations of cornflowers and leaves, against a white background.
Curator's comments: Colourful faience inlays and tiles were a feature of house, temple and palace decoration at Tell el-Amarna. See, for example: Fairman, City of Akhenaten II (London, 1933): pl.30 Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten III (London, 1951): pls.62, 72 Pharaohs of the Sun (exhibition catalogue, Boston, 1999): 228 (no.80 is another example with cornflowers).
Exhibition history: 2012 7 December - Sat 13 April 2013, Berlin, Neues Museum, In the Light of Amarna
Acquisition name: Donated by: Rev Greville John Chester
